Function to visualize the estimated exposures

Source: R/plot_exposures.R
plot_exposures.Rd

Function to visualize the estimated exposures

Usage

plot_exposures(
  x,
  types = get_types(x),
  samples = get_samples(x),
  clusters = get_cluster_labels(x),
  sample_name = F,
  sigs_levels = NULL,
  cls = NULL,
  add_centroid = FALSE,
  muts = FALSE,
  sort_by = NULL,
  elim_thr = 0
)

Arguments

x

basilica object.

types

List of variant types to visualize.

samples

List of samples to visualize.

clusters

List of clusters to visualize.

sample_name

Logical. If `TRUE`, sample names will be reported on the x axis.

sigs_levels

Deprecated.

cls

Custom color palette for signatures.

add_centroid

Logical. If `TRUE`, also clustering's centroids will be plotted.

muts

Deprecated.

sort_by

Signature to sort patients' exposures by.

elim

merge all signatures with low exposure as single signature called 'lowexp'

Value

ggplot object.

Examples

plot_exposures(example_fit)
#> Warning: No shared levels found between `names(values)` of the manual scale and the
#> data's colour values.
